Uses of Package

  • Classes in <Unnamed> used by <Unnamed>
    Class Description
    CollidingObject
    Interface to be implemented by any object with a collision interaction
    This is a general purpose collider interface, extend this with any specific types of collisions (e.g.
    ExampleKeyListener  
    ExampleMouseListener  
    Game
    The main class.
    GameObject
    Superclass for all objects within the game.
    Contains basic important information, and enforces required functions.
    GraphicalObject
    /** Interface to be implemented by any objects that are to display sprites
    Includes default loading and rendering scripts, which can be overwritten for complex cases
    (if there is more than one instance of a given complex case, form it into its own interface extending this)

    Required class variables
    Handler
    Handles any object currently updating or being rendered
    KeyInput
    A keyboard listener class.

    This should be public and static in the game class, and registered as a key listener in the Game constructor
    KeyListener
    Interface to be implemented by any objects that require keyboard input.
    KeyInput.java maintains a list of key listeners, and calls their keyPressed and keyReleased functions when an event is registered

    In the constructor
    MouseClickListener
    Interface to be implemented by any objects that require mouse click input.
    MouseInput.java maintains a list of key listeners, and calls their mouseClicked when an event is registered

    In the constructor
    MouseInput
    A mouse listener class.

    This should be public and static in the game class, and registered as a mouse listener and mouse motion listener in the Game constructor
    Contains a public static Point storing the position of the mouse on the screen
    SolidCollider
    Interface to be implemented by any object that must not allow an object to pass through it
    This interface extends CollidingObject, so you only need to implement this one.

    In the constructor
